intro: Micromeria juliana var. myrtifolia, commonly known as the Myrtleleaf micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and features small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight pubescence, while the stems are erect and branched. This variety is notable for its close relation to other members of the Micromeria genus, which are often used in traditional herbal medicine.
